column4: where can i find more info on setting up two network cards on the same computer?
do you want to setup some type of router?
im trying to connect a copmuter to the main network and directly to another computer via crossover cable
so you do not want the other computer to be part of the network?
but ubuntu is not allowing me to start both interfaces and ping both computers
maybe, but for now i just need them to "see" each other and for the main one to access the internet
what did you try and why did not work?
well... i tried the obvious... set up the two interfaces with different IP's, but it seems that only one of them can access its network  at any one given point
try to take a look at /etc/network/interfaces (sudo gedit <file>)
you should have eth0 and eth1, ... ifconfig lists the running interfaces, ifup eth0  e.g. brings eth0 up, ifdown does the opposite
i am well aware of that... however, go to #pastebin :P (i know thats not what you meant... but go there and ill show you my ifconfig)
security updates, you should really remove the hash (#), if you have any servers running
hmm.. well it seems to include updates to xserver-drivers... and im running this from an ssh session... i dont want to install these updates if they will make my computer not boot
if you do not start/need x, why should ssh be unreachable just because x does not start? *onwdering*
i would include it and hope that it works nonetheless (why should ssh stop to work?)
what about kernel modules? will any new modules added to "/etc/modules" be affected by updating the kernel?
